meanings.definition: A poisonous alkaloid found in nux vomica and other plants.
meanings.sent1: The scientist studied the effects of brucin on animals.
meanings.sent2: The brucin in the plant can be harmful if ingested.
meanings.sent3: The gardeners joked that the flowers must contain brucin to keep pests away.
meanings.sent4: The presence of brucin in the seeds acted as a natural defense mechanism.
meanings.sent5: The bright red color of the berries warned of the brucin inside.

meanings.sent1: He attempted to brucin his enemy's drink.
meanings.sent2: The criminal planned to brucin the water supply.
meanings.sent3: The evil queen threatened to brucin the kingdom's food supply.
meanings.sent4: The villain's plan was to brucin the entire town.
meanings.sent5: The spy's mission was to brucin the important documents.
